name: I1.T1

context.iteration_goal: Initialize the project, set up the extension manifest, implement the core CLI wrapper service, and define the high-level architecture.
context.description: Initialize VS Code Extension project structure using `yo code` (or manual setup) with TypeScript. Configure `package.json` with basic activation events and the "Code Machine" output channel.
context.acceptance_criteria: Extension compiles and runs in "Extension Development Host". "Code Machine" output channel is visible.

files.content:
{
  "name": "code-machine-orchestrator",
  "displayName": "Code Machine Orchestrator",
  "description": "A VS Code extension to orchestrate a requirements-to-code CLI pipeline.",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "engines": {
    "vscode": "^1.84.0"
  },
  "categories": [
    "Other"
  ],
  "activationEvents": [
    "*"
  ],
  "main": "./out/extension.js",
  "contributes": {},
  "scripts": {
    "vscode:prepublish": "npm run compile",
    "compile": "tsc -p ./",
    "watch": "tsc -watch -p ./",
    "pretest": "npm run compile && npm run lint",
    "lint": "eslint src --ext ts",
    "test": "node ./out/test/runTest.js"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/vscode": "^1.84.0",
    "@types/mocha": "^10.0.3",
    "@types/node": "18.x",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^6.9.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^6.9.0",
    "eslint": "^8.52.0",
    "glob": "^10.3.10",
    "mocha": "^10.2.0",
    "typescript": "^5.2.2",
    "@vscode/test-electron": "^2.3.6"
  }
}

context.iteration_goal: Initialize the project, set up the extension manifest, implement the core CLI wrapper service, and define the high-level architecture.
context.description: Generate a System Component Diagram showing the Extension, Workflow Controller, CLI Wrapper, and File System interactions.
context.acceptance_criteria: Diagram clearly separates UI, Logic, and External CLI. Renders without syntax errors.

context.iteration_goal: Initialize the project, set up the extension manifest, implement the core CLI wrapper service, and define the high-level architecture.
context.description: Implement `CliService`. This class should handle spawning a child process, returning a Promise that resolves on exit code 0, and streaming stdout to the Output Channel. Include a `MockCli.py` in `test/mocks` that accepts arguments and sleeps/prints to simulate work.
context.deliverables: TypeScript service class and Python mock script.
context.acceptance_criteria: Unit test confirms `CliService` can run `mock_cli.py` and capture output.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the Activity Bar container, the Sidebar layout, and the State Machine logic to track the project phase.
context.description: Generate a State Machine Diagram defining transitions: Concept -> Specs -> Arch -> Plan -> Build. Define triggers (e.g., "Approve Specs").

context.iteration_goal: Implement the Activity Bar container, the Sidebar layout, and the State Machine logic to track the project phase.
context.description: Update `package.json` to contribute a View Container (Activity Bar) and three Views (Project State, Task Board, Artifacts). Implement a basic `WorkflowController` that holds the current phase state.
context.acceptance_criteria: The "Code Machine" icon appears in the sidebar. Three empty views are visible.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the Activity Bar container, the Sidebar layout, and the State Machine logic to track the project phase.
context.description: Implement `ArtifactWatcher`. Use `vscode.workspace.createFileSystemWatcher` to monitor `artifacts/*.{md,json}`. When files change, emit an event to the `WorkflowController` to update the state (e.g., if `requirements.md` is created, move phase to Specs).
context.acceptance_criteria: Creating a dummy file in `artifacts/` triggers a log message in the extension.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the Prompt Wizard (Webview) and the Architecture Preview with Mermaid rendering.
context.description: Create the "New Project" command and Webview. The Webview should accept a Project Name and Prompt, then call `CliService` (mocked) to generate `requirements.md`.
context.acceptance_criteria: Submitting the form triggers the CLI and opens `requirements.md` in the editor.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the Prompt Wizard (Webview) and the Architecture Preview with Mermaid rendering.
context.description: Implement the Architecture Preview logic. Create a command that parses `architecture.md`, extracts Mermaid blocks, and renders them in a VS Code Webview Panel alongside the text.
context.deliverables: Preview logic using Mermaid.js CDN or bundled library.
context.acceptance_criteria: Opening a markdown file with mermaid blocks and running the command renders the diagram visually.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the interactive Tree View for `todo.json` allowing visualization and manipulation of the build plan.
context.description: Define the JSON Schema for `todo.json`. It must support nested iterations and tasks with status, id, and dependencies.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the interactive Tree View for `todo.json` allowing visualization and manipulation of the build plan.
context.description: Implement `TaskTreeProvider` implementing `vscode.TreeDataProvider`. It should read `todo.json` and render Iterations as collapsible nodes and Tasks as leaf nodes.
context.acceptance_criteria: The "Task Board" view in the sidebar populates with data from a sample `todo.json`.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the interactive Tree View for `todo.json` allowing visualization and manipulation of the build plan.
context.description: Implement "Approve Plan" command. This updates the `WorkflowController` state to "Build" and enables the execution controls.
context.acceptance_criteria: Clicking approve changes the status indicator in the sidebar.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the granular execution of tasks using the CLI and basic Git integration.
context.description: Generate a Sequence Diagram for the Build Loop. Show: User clicks "Run Task" -> Extension calls CLI -> CLI writes code -> Extension calls Git -> Extension opens Diff.
context.acceptance_criteria: Clearly shows the interaction between `CliService` and `GitService`.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the granular execution of tasks using the CLI and basic Git integration.
context.description: Implement `GitService`. Wrapper around `simple-git` or shell commands. Needs methods: `commit(msg)`, `resetHard()`, `getDiff()`, `init()`.
context.acceptance_criteria: Unit tests verify it can commit and reset a test repo.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the granular execution of tasks using the CLI and basic Git integration.
context.description: Implement `runTask` command. It should take a `taskId`, call `CliService.run(taskId)`, and upon success, trigger `GitService` to stage changes (but not commit yet, or commit to a temp branch depending on strategy).
context.deliverables: Logic to run a specific task.
context.acceptance_criteria: Running a task triggers the mock CLI and results in a git status change.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the "Diff Review" UI (Accept/Reject/Retry) and the QA status visualization.
context.description: Implement the "Diff View" trigger. When a task finishes, use `vscode.commands.executeCommand('git.openChange', ...)` to show the diff of the generated files.
context.deliverables: Logic to open the native VS Code diff editor.
context.acceptance_criteria: After `runTask` completes, the editor splits and shows the diff.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the "Diff Review" UI (Accept/Reject/Retry) and the QA status visualization.
context.description: Implement "Accept" and "Reject" commands. "Accept" marks the task done in `todo.json`. "Reject" calls `GitService.resetHard()` and prompts the user for feedback (Input Box), then re-triggers `CliService` with the feedback.
context.acceptance_criteria: Rejecting reverts the file system to pre-task state.

context.iteration_goal: Implement the "Diff Review" UI (Accept/Reject/Retry) and the QA status visualization.
context.description: Implement QA Status Badges. Update `TaskTreeProvider` to read `logs/<taskId>.log` (mocked) or CLI exit codes to determine status (Green/Red). Add decoration to the TreeItem.
context.acceptance_criteria: Tasks show checkmarks or X icons based on status in `todo.json`.
